metadata.description: RECOVER PROJECT WILL BE IMPLEMENTED FOR 12 MONTHS. THE RECOVER PROJECT SEEKS TO RESTORE, STABILIZE, AND REINFORCE FOOD SECURITY AND INCOMES DISRUPTED BY THE MID-SEASON LONG DRY SPELL EXPERIENCED IN THE 2017/18 AGRICULTURE SEASON. THE PROJECT WILL TARGET VULNERABLE, DRY SPELL AFFECTED HOUSEHOLDS, INCLUDING THOSE OF PEOPLE LIVING WITH DISABILITIES, IN BULILIMS, GWANDA, MANGWE, AND MATOBO DISTRICTS. CURRENTLY, CRS IS IMPLEMENTING THE OFDA-FUNDED ZIMBABWE EL NINO RELIEF SOUTH (ZEN) II PROJECT IN BULILIMA, GWANDA, INSIZA, AND UMZINGWANE DISTRICTS. CRS PROPOSES TO PHASE OUT OF UMZINGWANE AND INSIZA DISTRICTS IN THE PROPOSED PROJECT AS THEY ARE CONSIDERED BETTER OFF IN TERMS OF FOOD AND INCOME SECURITY AS COMPARED TO MATOBO AND MANGWE. UMZINGWANE AND INSIZA HAVE BEEN CATEGORIZED UNDER IPC PHASE 2 (STRESSED) AS COMPARED TO THE NEW PROPOSED DISTRICTS WHICH ARE AT IPC LEVEL 3. CRS SEEKS TO ENSURE FOOD AND INCOME SECURITY RECOVERY, WHICH WILL BE ACHIEVED THROUGH 2 STRATEGIC OBJECTIVES: (1) FOOD SMART AGRICULTURE AND ACCESS TO INFORMATION; AND (2) VULNERABLE HHS HAVE INCREASED ACCESS TO SAVINGS AND LOANS. THE PROJECT WILL PROMOTE THE USE OF GOOD AGRICULTURAL PRACTICES/TECHNOLOGIES, INCREASE KNOWLEDGE AND AWARENESS TO SHOCKS AND STRESSES, AND INCREASE ACCESS TO DISPOSABLE INCOME THROUGH CRS' SAVINGS AND INTERNAL LENDING COMMUNITIES (SILC) METHODOLOGY. THE PROJECT WILL BUILD ON 2 YEARS OF LESSONS LEARNED THROUGH THE ZEN AND ZEN II PROJECTS WHERE SILC, DROUGHT TOLERANT CROPS, SMALL STOCK, EXTENSION AND EARLY WARNING SYSTEM WERE CITED AS KEY DRIVERS OF COMMUNITY RECOVERY.

AGRICULTURE IS THE BACKBONE OF ZIMBABWEÃ¢Â‚¬Â„¢S ECONOMY. ZIMBABWEANS REMAIN LARGELY A RURAL PEOPLE WHO DERIVE THEIR LIVELIHOOD FROM AGRICULTURE AND OTHER RELATED RURAL ECONOMIC ACTIVITIES. ACCORDING TO THE FOOD AGRICULTURAL ORGANIZATION, IT PROVIDES EMPLOYMENT AND INCOME FOR 60-70 PER CENT OF THE POPULATION. 
THE FOOD SECURITY SITUATION IN ZIMBABWE IS DIRECTLY CONNECTED TO A NUMBER OF FACTORS INCLUDING DOMESTIC AGRICULTURAL PRODUCTION, THE IMPACT OF POVERTY AND PREVAILING ECONOMIC CHALLENGES ON ACCESS TO FOOD AND BASIC SERVICES, ADVERSE WEATHER CONDITIONS SUCH AS DROUGHT/FLOODING, RELATED SHIFTING CLIMATE PATTERNS AND CHANGING DEMOGRAPHICS RELATED TO HIV AND MIGRATION. 
IN RESPONSE TO THE EL NIÃƑÂ±O-INDUCED DROUGHT DURING THE 2015/2016 CROPPING SEASON, CATHOLIC RELIEF SERVICES (CRS) PARTNERED WITH ADRA AND CARITAS BULAWAYO TO IMPLEMENT THE 12-MONTH ZIMBABWE EL NIÃƑÂ±O RELIEF SOUTH PROJECT (ZEN). THIS PROJECT IS DUE FOR COMPLETION IN JULY 2017. THE PROJECT TARGETS THE DISTRICTS OF GWANDA, UMZINGWANE, INSIZA AND BULILIMA IN MATABELELAND SOUTH PROVINCE. 
IN FEBRUARY 2017, TROPICAL STORM DINEO HIT ZIMBABWE CAUSING SIGNIFICANT DAMAGE AND DESTRUCTION IN THE SOUTHERN PARTS OF THE COUNTRY, WHILE EXCESSIVE RAINS HAMPERED CURRENT RECOVERY EFFORTS. AS A CONSEQUENCE, MANY AFFECTED HOUSEHOLDS WILL BE UNABLE TO REALIZE FULL RECOVERY DURING THE 2016/2017 CROPPING SEASON. WHILE MANY FAMILIES RECEIVED SOME RELIEF FOLLOWING THESE SHOCKS, CONTINUED INVESTMENTS IN ACTIVITIES THAT WILL HELP FAMILIES RECOVER FROM THE DROUGHT AND SUBSEQUENT HEAVY RAINS/FLOODING WILL ALLOW VULNERABLE HOUSEHOLDS TO RESTORE AGRICULTURAL PRODUCTIVITY.
CRS, IN PARTNERSHIP WITH CARITAS BULAWAYO AND ADRA IS PLEASED TO PRESENT A PROPOSAL FOR A SECOND PHASE OF THE ZIMBABWE EL NIÃƑÂ±O RELIEF PROJECT (ZEN II). THIS WILL ENABLE THE CONTINUED STRENGTHENING OF COMMUNITY AND DISTRICT CAPACITIES TO PREPARE FOR AND MITIGATE THE HAZARDS OF CLIMATE VARIATION BY FURTHER DEVELOPING A CULTURE OF RISK AWARENESS, ASSESSMENT AND CONTINGENCY PLANNING. THIS APPROACH WILL BE COUPLED WITH ONGOING IMPROVEMENTS TO LIVELIHOODS PROTECTION SYSTEMS AND ENHANCED TRAINING AND SUPPORT ON IMPROVED PRODUCTION TECHNIQUES TO INCREASE RESILIENCE TO EXTREME WEATHER VARIABILITY IN FLOOD IMPACTED AREAS.
THE ZEN II PROPOSED PACKAGE OF INTERVENTIONS WILL LEVERAGE THE INITIAL RECOVERY EFFORTS UNDER ZEN AND INCLUDE SOME ADDITIONAL ACTIVITIES BASED ON LESSONS LEARNED AND FEEDBACK FROM COMMUNITIES AND OTHER STAKEHOLDERS. ZEN II WILL IMPLEMENT INTERVENTIONS FOCUSED ON AGRICULTURE RECOVERY WITH AN EMPHASIS ON AGRICULTURAL INPUTS PROVISION; FODDER PRODUCTION AND FODDER SEED MULTIPLICATION; FODDER MARKET LINKAGES; IMPROVED LIVESTOCK MANAGEMENT; POST-HARVEST MANAGEMENT TECHNOLOGIES; FARM-LEVEL NATURAL RESOURCES MANAGEMENT; AND INCREASING ACCESS TO RURAL MICRO-FINANCE SUPPORT. VULNERABLE FARMING HOUSEHOLDS, ALREADY IMPACTED BY EL NIÃƑÂ±O, AND FURTHER AFFECTED BY TROPICAL STORM DINEO, WILL BE SUPPORTED TO FULLY RECOVER, PREPARE FOR THE 2017/18 AGRICULTURE SEASON, AND BUILD LONG-TERM RESILIENCE THROUGH ADDRESSING BOTH HOUSEHOLD AND COMMUNITY PREPAREDNESS. IT WILL ALSO TARGET ROOT CAUSES OF VULNERABILITIES AT THE HOUSEHOLD LEVEL.

CATHOLIC RELIEF SERVICES (CRS), IN PARTNERSHIP WITH CARITAS BULAWAYO AND ADRA ZIMBABWE IS IMPLEMENTING THE ZIMBABWE EI NINO RELIEF SOUTH (ZEN RELIEF SOUTH) PROJECT WHICH FOCUSES ON AGRICULTURE RECOVERY ACTIVITIES FOR THE DROUGHT AFFECTED COMMUNITIES IN UMZINGWANE, BULILIMA, GWANDA AND INSIZA DISTRICTS OF MATABELELAND SOUTH PROVINCE IN ZIMBABWE, TARGETING 8,975 HOUSEHOLDS. ZEN RELIEF SOUTH AIMS TO ASSIST THESE COMMUNITIES TO ACCESS INPUTS AND RECOVER FROM THE EFFECTS OF THIS DROUGHT THROUGH DIVERSIFICATION IN NUTRITION AND ENHANCED RESILIENCE (DINER) FAIRS APPROACH, TRAININGS IN LIVESTOCK, CROP AND FODDER PRODUCTION AS WELL AS SAVINGS AND INTERNAL LENDING COMMUNITIES ACTIVITIES (SILC). THE PROJECT, WHOSE GOAL IS TO IMPROVE FOOD SECURITY AND RECOVERY CAPACITY OF VULNERABLE HOUSEHOLDS IN GWANDA, UMZINGWANE, INSIZA AND BULILIMA DISTRICTS OF ZIMBABWE, STARTED ON AUGUST 01, 2016 AND WILL END ON 25 JULY, 2017 AND THE OBJECTIVES ARE TO ENSURE THAT; 1)VULNERABLE HOUSEHOLDS RESTORE THEIR AGRICULTURAL PRODUCTION CAPACITIES. 2) VULNERABLE HOUSEHOLDS HAVE INCREASED ACCESS TO SAVINGS AND LOANS.

CATHOLIC RELIEF SERVICES (CRS), IN PARTNERSHIP WITH CARITAS BULAWAYO AND ADRA ZIMBABWE IS IMPLEMENTING THE ZIMBABWE EI NINO RELIEF SOUTH (ZEN RELIEF SOUTH) PROJECT WHICH FOCUSES ON AGRICULTURE RECOVERY ACTIVITIES FOR THE DROUGHT AFFECTED COMMUNITIES IN UMZINGWANE, BULILIMA, GWANDA AND INSIZA DISTRICTS OF MATABELELAND SOUTH PROVINCE IN ZIMBABWE, TARGETING 8,975 HOUSEHOLDS. ZEN RELIEF SOUTH AIMS TO ASSIST THESE COMMUNITIES TO ACCESS INPUTS AND RECOVER FROM THE EFFECTS OF THIS DROUGHT THROUGH DIVERSIFICATION IN NUTRITION AND ENHANCED RESILIENCE (DINER) FAIRS APPROACH, TRAININGS IN LIVESTOCK, CROP AND FODDER PRODUCTION AS WELL AS SAVINGS AND INTERNAL LENDING COMMUNITIES ACTIVITIES (SILC). THE PROJECT, WHOSE GOAL IS TO IMPROVE FOOD SECURITY AND RECOVERY CAPACITY OF VULNERABLE HOUSEHOLDS IN GWANDA, UMZINGWANE, INSIZA AND BULILIMA DISTRICTS OF ZIMBABWE, STARTED ON AUGUST 01, 2016 AND WILL END ON 25 JULY, 2017 AND THE OBJECTIVES ARE TO ENSURE THAT; 1)VULNERABLE HOUSEHOLDS RESTORE THEIR AGRICULTURAL PRODUCTION CAPACITIES. 2) VULNERABLE HOUSEHOLDS HAVE INCREASED ACCESS TO SAVINGS AND LOANS.
CHOICES MATTER

THROUGH THE INDUSTRY-DRIVEN IT APPRENTICESHIP PROGRAM, THE MISSOURI CHAMBER FOUNDATION PROVIDES SUPPORT TO IT COMPANIES THAT ARE CREATING OR EXPANDING REGISTERED APPRENTICESHIP PROGRAMS. THE MISSOURI CHAMBER FOUNDATION PROVIDES AN $800-$1,200 REIMBURSEMENT PER APPRENTICE TRAINED BY PARTICIPATING COMPANIES, WHILE THE COMPANIES IN THE GRANT SERVE AS MENTORS TO EACH OTHER AND SHARE BEST PRACTICES TO IMPROVE THEIR TRAINING AND RECRUITING SYSTEMS. OVER THE FOUR YEARS OF THE GRANT, THE MISSOURI CHAMBER FOUNDATION WILL HELP TRAIN MORE THAN 5,300 IT APPRENTICES. THIS PROGRAM IS MADE POSSIBLE BY A $6 MILLION GRANT FROM THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF LABOR.

CATHOLIC RELIEF SERVICES (CRS) AND ITS PARTNERS WILL IMPLEMENT THE PATHWAYS PROJECT IN RESPONSE TO NFO SOL-613-17-000005. PATHWAYS WILL USE ECONOMIC STRENGTHENING, LOCAL OWNERSHIP AND LEADERSHIP, AND GENDER TRANSFORMATION TO STRENGTHEN THE CAPACITY OF HIV-AFFECTED INDIVIDUALS , HOUSEHOLDS (HH) AND COMMUNITIES TO PROGRESS ALONG PATHWAYS OUT OF POVERTY, ALONG FUNCTIONAL SERVICE REFERRAL PATHWAYS , ALONG CONTINUUM OF CARE PATHWAYS TO REACH THE 90-90-90 TARGETS , AND ALONG AGE AND STAGE APPROPRIATE PATHWAYS THAT PROMOTE POSITIVE CHILD, ADOLESCENT, AND YOUTH HEALTH, WELLBEING, AND DEVELOPMENT. PATHWAYS WILL DELIVER A CHILD-CENTERED, FAMILY-FOCUSED, COMMUNITY-BASED PACKAGE OF EVIDENCE-BASED/INFORMED INTERVENTIONS IN BULAWAYO, GURUVE, GWERU, HARARE, INSIZA,LUPANE, MATOBO, MAZOE, AND NKAYI WITH THESE KEY RESULTS: (1) 250,000 HIV-AFFECTED ORPHANS AND VULNERABLE CHILDREN (OVC) AND OVC HH MEMBERS HAVE THE KNOWLEDGE , SKILLS, SOCIAL SUPPORT, AND ACCESS TO SERVICES TO ENABLE THEN TO MITIGATE THE IMPACT OF HIV ON THEIR LIVES; (2) 59,500 HH ARE ECONOMICALLY RESILIENT AND PROVIDE POSITIVE PARENTING AND A SAFE HOME ENVIRONMENT TO PROTECT THE HEALTH AND WELLBEING OF THE CHILDREN IN THEIR CARE ; (3) COMMUNITIES IN 118 WARDS ARE HIV COMPETENT, WITH VESTED LONG-TERM OVC PLANS; (4) 15,000 VULNERABLE YOUTH HAVE INCREASED LIVELIHOODS SKILLS AND OPTIONS AS A RESULT OF HOLISTIC ENTREPRENEURSHIP, EMPLOYABILITY AND VOCATIONAL TRAINING PROGRAMS

metadata.description:
CRS, IN PARTNERSHIP WITH CARITAS MUTARE, WILL BE IMPLEMENTING A CIRP PROJECT  FROM(1 OCTOBER, 2019 TO 31 DECEMBER, 2019), CYCLONE IDAI RESPONSE PROJECT (CIRP) TO PROVIDE LATRINES TO 634 HOUSEHOLDS, AND TOOLS AND CONDUCT HYGIENE PROMOTION ACTIVITIES TARGETING 4,500 HOUSEHOLDS IN FOUR WARDS OF BUHERA DISTRICT NAMELY, WARDS 27, 28, 29 AND 33. THE TARGETED HOUSEHOLDS WERE TARGETED THROUGH HOUSE-TO-HOUSE VERIFICATIONS CONTACTED UNDER THE SHELTER PROJECT BEING IMPLEMENTED IN THE SAME WARDS. . THE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE:

A) DISTRIBUTION OF TOOLKITS BENEFITING 900 CYCLONE-AFFECTED HOUSEHOLDS;
B) DISTRIBUTION OF LATRINE CONSTRUCTION MATERIALS TARGETING 634 CYCLONE-AFFECTED HOUSEHOLDS, AND
C) CONDUCTING COMMUNITY AND HOUSE-TO-HOUSE HYGIENE PROMOTION TARGETING 900 HOUSEHOLDS. 
D) MONITORING OF PROJECT ACTIVITIES AND STAKEHOLDER LIAISON.
E)REPORT WRITING AND SHARING WITH ALL STAKEHOLDERS

ENDER TRANSFORMATION TO STRENGTHEN THE CAPACITY OF HIV-AFFECTED INDIVIDUALS , HOUSEHOLDS (HH) AND COMMUNITIES TO PROGRESS ALONG PATHWAYS OUT OF POVERTY, ALONG FUNCTIONAL SERVICE REFERRAL PATHWAYS , ALONG CONTINUUM OF CARE PATHWAYS TO REACH THE 90-90-90 TARGETS , AND ALONG AGE AND STAGE APPROPRIATE PATHWAYS THAT PROMOTE POSITIVE CHILD, ADOLESCENT, AND YOUTH HEALTH, WELLBEING, AND DEVELOPMENT. PATHWAYS WILL DELIVER A CHILD-CENTERED, FAMILY-FOCUSED, COMMUNITY-BASED PACKAGE OF EVIDENCE-BASED/INFORMED INTERVENTIONS IN BULAWAYO, GURUVE, GWERU, HARARE, INSIZA,LUPANE, MATOBO, MAZOE, AND NKAYI WITH THESE KEY RESULTS: (1) 250,000 HIV-AFFECTED ORPHANS AND VULNERABLE CHILDREN (OVC) AND OVC HH MEMBERS HAVE THE KNOWLEDGE , SKILLS, SOCIAL SUPPORT, AND ACCESS TO SERVICES TO ENABLE THEN TO MITIGATE THE IMPACT OF HIV ON THEIR LIVES; (2) 59,500 HH ARE ECONOMICALLY RESILIENT AND PROVIDE POSITIVE PARENTING AND A SAFE HOME ENVIRONMENT TO PROTECT THE HEALTH AND WELLBEING OF THE CHILDREN IN THEIR CARE ; (3) COMMUNITIES IN 118 WARDS ARE HIV COMPETENT, WITH VESTED LONG-TERM OVC PLANS; (4) 15,000 VULNERABLE YOUTH HAVE INCREASED LIVELIHOODS SKILLS AND OPTIONS AS A RESULT OF HOLISTIC ENTREPRENEURSHIP, EMPLOYABILITY AND VOCATIONAL TRAINING PROGRAMS

CRS AND ITS PARTNERS WILL IMPLEMENT THE PATHWAYS PROJECT IN RESPONSE TO NFO SOL-613-17-00005. PATHWAYS WILL USE ECONOMIC STRENGTHENING, LOCAL OWNERSHIP AND LEADERSHIP, AND GENDER TRANSFORMATION TO STRENGTHEN THE CAPACITY OF HIV-AFFECTED INDIVIDUALS, HOUSEHOLDS (HH) AND COMMUNITIES TO PROGRESS ALONG PATHWAYS OUT OF POVERTY, ALONG FUNCTIONAL SERVICE REFERRAL PATHWAYS, ALONG CONTINUUM OF CARE PATHWAYS TO REACH THE 90-90-90 TARGETS, AND ALONG AGE AND STAGE APPROPRIATE PATHWAYS THAT PROMOTE POSITIVE CHILD, ADOLESCENT, AND YOUTH HEALTH, WELL-BEING, AND DEVELOPMENT. PATHWAYS WILL DELIVER A CHILD-CENTERED, FAMILY-FOCUSED, COMMUNITY-BASED PACKAGE OF EVIDENCE-BASED/INFORMED INTERVENTIONS IN BULAWAYO, GURUVE, GWERU, HARARE, INSIZA, LUPANE, MATOBO, MAZOWE, AND NKAYI WITH THESE KEY RESULTS: (1) 250,000 HIV-AFFECTED ORPHANS AND VULNERABLE CHILDREN (OVC) AND OVC HH MEMBERS HAVE THE KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, SOCIAL SUPPORT, AND ACCESS TO SERVICES TO ENABLE THEM TO MITIGATE THE IMPACT OF HIV ON THEIR LIVES; (2) 59,500 HH ARE ECONOMICALLY RESILIENT AND PROVIDE POSITIVE PARENTING AND A SAFE HOME ENVIRONMENT TO PROTECT THE HEALTH AND WELL-BEING OF THE CHILDREN IN THEIR CARE; (3) COMMUNITIES IN 118 WARDS ARE HIV COMPETENT, WITH VESTED LONG-TERM OVC PLANS; (4) 15,000 VULNERABLE YOUTH HAVE INCREASED LIVELIHOODS, SKILLS, AND OPTIONS AS A RESULT OF HOLISTIC ENTREPRENEURSHIP, EMPLOYABILITY AND VOCATIONAL TRAINING PROGRAMS.
UNDER THE PATHWAYS PROJECT, CHILDLINE ZIMBABWE WILL BE IMPLEMENTING THE ABOVE INTERVENTIONS IN BULAWAY, GWERU, AND MAZOWE DISTRICTS. ADDITIONALLY, CHILDLINE ZIMBABWE WILL FOCUS PROVISION OF SPECIALIZED THERAPEUTIC SERVICES, SUCH AS SPECIALIZED COUNSELING AND THERAPEUTIC SUPPORT GROUPS TO SURVIVORS OF ABUSE IN ORDER TO BRING HEALING AND RECOVERY FROM THE IMPACT OF TRAUMATIC EXPERIENCES. A CASE MGMT APPROACH, TARGETING CHILDREN AND THEIR FAMILIES WILL BE USED TO PROVIDE HOLISTIC SERVICES THAT BRING LONG LASTING IMPACT TO THE AFFECTED CHILDREN.
PATHWAYS PROJECT WILL ALSO MAKE USE OF THE 116 NATIONAL HELPLINE WHERE CHILDREN WILL HAVE ACCESS TO A SAFE, CONFIDENTIAL AND CHILD FRIENDLY REPORTING PLATFORM TO REPORT CASES OF VIOLENCE AND ABUSE. THE PLATFORM WILL BE AVAILABLE IN ALL THE DISTRICTS UNDER THE PATHWAYS PROJECT AND A REFERRAL SYSTEM WILL BE USED TO APPROPRIATE SERVICE PROVIDERS FOR FURTHER MANAGEMENT OF THE REPORTED CASES AFTER AN INITIAL SERVICE HAS BEEN PROVIDED WITHIN THE HELPLINE. CHILDLINE WILL ALSO FOCUS ON ADVOCACY WORK AROUND CHILD PROTECTION ISSUES AND THE IMPACT OF HIV PLACING PARTICULAR EMPHASIS ON MEETING THE UN AIDS 90-90-90 TARGETS.

entities.primary_name: DIOCESE OF CHINHOYI - CATHOLIC COMMISSION FOR JUSTICE AND PEACE

metadata.description: THE GOAL OF RE-SHAPING OUR WORLD  (RE-SOW) PROJECT IS "RECONCILED COMMUNITIES WORK TOGETHER WITH THEIR LEADERS TO MANAGE CONFLICTS NON-VIOLENTLY AND SOLVE PROBLEMS OF PEACE AND DEVELOPMENT". TO ACHIEVE THIS GOAL, CRS PARTNERS WITH WITH CATHOLIC COMMISSION FOR JUSTICE AND PEACE, (CCJP) CHINHOYI DIOCESE. THE PROJECT BRINGS PEOPLE TOGETHER THROUGH VARIOUS ACTIVITIES TO BUILD SOCIAL COHESION. RE-SOW HAS BINDING, BONDING AND BRIDGING ACTIVITIES SUCH AS COMMUNITY VOICES FORUMS, COLLABORATIVE PROJECTS, PEACEBUILDING TRAININGS, PEACE EVENTS, YOUTH VOICES FORUMS AMONG OTHERS. THESE ACTIVITIES STRENGTHEN COMMUNAL BONDS WHILE REDUCING MISTRUST AMONGST COMMUNITY MEMBERS. WITH TECHNICAL SUPPORT FROM TREE OF LIFE, THE PROJECT ALSO SUPPORTS INDIVIDUALS AND COMMUNITIES TO ADDRESS UNRESOLVED TRAUMA RESULTING IN SOCIALLY RESILIENT COMMUNITIES THAT ADDRESS NEGATIVE EFFECTS OF TRAUMA FROM PAST AND PRESENT VIOLENCE. TRAUMA UNDERMINES SOCIAL COHESION. THE PROJECT ALSO FACILITATES CHANGES IN ATTITUDES AND BEHAVIOURS OF TARGETED GROUPS OF COMMUNITY AND LOCAL LEADERS. OPPORTUNITIES ARE CREATED FOR KEY ACTORS AT THE COMMUNITY LEVELS  TO INTERACT,  BUILD TRUST AND PARTICIPATED IN CONFLICT MANAGEMENT WITH COMMUNITIES.

IN PARTNERSHIP WITH THE CATHOLIC COMMISSION FOR JUSTICE AND PEACE IN MASVINGO AND CHINHOYI, AND WITH TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE FROM SILVEIRA HOUSE, CRS WILL IMPLEMENT SOW TO ENABLE TARGET
COMMUNITIES TO BETTER MANAGE POLITICAL DIFFERENCES NONVIOLENTLY. THE PROJECT WILL SEEK TO INCREASE TRUST ACROSS POLITICAL DIVISIONS (SO1), BETTER CONNECT YOUTH TO THEIR COMMUNITIES (SO2), AND BUILD COMMUNITIES RESISTANCE TO POLITICAL VIOLENCE (SO3). MORE THAN 2,000 INDIVIDUALS IN 41 COMMUNITIES WILL DIRECTLY BENEFIT FROM PROJECT ACTIVITIES, WITH THOUSANDS OF ADDITIONAL COMMUNITY MEMBERS HAVING THE OPPORTUNITY TO PARTICIPATE IN PEOPLE-TO-PEOPLE ACTIVITIES THAT WILL FOSTER PEACEFUL INTERACTIONS AMONG THOSE WITH DIFFERING POLITICAL VIEWS. THE APPROACH IS BASED ON THE "CULTURE OF PEACE" THEORY OF CHANGE: IF ENOUGH PEOPLE CHANGE THEIR BEHAVIOR TOWARDS GROUPS WITH WHICH THEY ARE IN CONFLICT, THEN MORE PEOPLE WILL BE WILLING TO RESIST THE EFFORTS OF KEY ACTORS TO AGITATE THEM INTO ENGAGING IN VIOLENCE. INSTEAD, MORE PEOPLE WILL ADOPT NONVIOLENT MEANS TO RESOLVE THEIR CONFLICTS WITH OPPOSING GROUPS AND INSIST THAT KEY ACTORS DO THE SAME.

IN PARTNERSHIP WITH THE CATHOLIC COMMISSION FOR JUSTICE AND PEACE IN MASVINGO AND CHINHOYI, AND WITH TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE FROM SILVEIRA HOUSE, CRS WILL IMPLEMENT SOW TO ENABLE TARGET
COMMUNITIES TO BETTER MANAGE PEACE BUILDING ACTIVITIES AND ENHANCE THE SOCIAL TEACHING OF THE CHURCH. THE PROJECT WILL SEEK TO INCREASE TRUST ACROSS COMMUNITIES (SO1), BETTER CONNECT YOUTH TO THEIR COMMUNITIES (SO2), AND BUILD COMMUNITIES RESILIENCE TO CONFLICT (SO3). MORE THAN 2,000 INDIVIDUALS IN 41 COMMUNITIES WILL DIRECTLY BENEFIT FROM PROJECT ACTIVITIES, WITH THOUSANDS OF ADDITIONAL COMMUNITY MEMBERS HAVING THE OPPORTUNITY TO PARTICIPATE IN PEOPLE-TO-PEOPLE ACTIVITIES THAT WILL FOSTER PEACEFUL INTERACTIONS AMONG THOSE WITH DIFFERING VIEWS. THE APPROACH IS BASED ON THE "CULTURE OF PEACE" THEORY OF CHANGE: IF ENOUGH PEOPLE CHANGE THEIR BEHAVIOR TOWARDS THEIR DIFFERENCES, THEN MORE PEOPLE WILL APPRECIATE PEACE AND RECONCILIATION IN THEIR VARIOUS SOCIAL SETTINGS.

metadata.description: TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE IN MEETING THE TRANSPORTATION NEEDS OF SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WHERE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES ARE UNAVAILABLE, INSUFFICIENT OR INAPPROPRIATE. THE SECTION 5310 PROGRAM IS DESIGNED TO SUPPLEMENT FTA'S OTHER CAPITAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS BY FUNDING TRANSPORTATION PROJECTS FOR SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES IN ALL AREAS - URBANIZED, SMALL URBAN, AND RURAL. THE PROGRAM INCLUDES NEW FREEDOM PROGRAM ACTIVITIES AS ELIGIBLE PROJECTS.

RECOVER PROJECT WILL BE IMPLEMENTED FOR 12 MONTHS. THE RECOVER PROJECT SEEKS TO RESTORE, STABILIZE, AND REINFORCE FOOD SECURITY AND INCOMES DISRUPTED BY THE MID-SEASON LONG DRY SPELL EXPERIENCED IN THE 2017/18 AGRICULTURE SEASON. THE PROJECT WILL TARGET VULNERABLE, DRY SPELL AFFECTED HOUSEHOLDS, INCLUDING THOSE OF PEOPLE LIVING WITH DISABILITIES, IN BULILIMS, GWANDA, MANGWE, AND MATOBO DISTRICTS. CURRENTLY, CRS IS IMPLEMENTING THE OFDA-FUNDED ZIMBABWE EL NINO RELIEF SOUTH (ZEN) II PROJECT IN BULILIMA, GWANDA, INSIZA, AND UMZINGWANE DISTRICTS. CRS PROPOSES TO PHASE OUT OF UMZINGWANE AND INSIZA DISTRICTS IN THE PROPOSED PROJECT AS THEY ARE CONSIDERED BETTER OFF IN TERMS OF FOOD AND INCOME SECURITY AS COMPARED TO MATOBO AND MANGWE. UMZINGWANE AND INSIZA HAVE BEEN CATEGORIZED UNDER IPC PHASE 2 (STRESSED) AS COMPARED TO THE NEW PROPOSED DISTRICTS WHICH ARE AT IPC LEVEL 3. CRS SEEKS TO ENSURE FOOD AND INCOME SECURITY RECOVERY, WHICH WILL BE ACHIEVED THROUGH 2 STRATEGIC OBJECTIVES: (1) FOOD SMART AGRICULTURE AND ACCESS TO INFORMATION; AND (2) VULNERABLE HHS HAVE INCREASED ACCESS TO SAVINGS AND LOANS. THE PROJECT WILL PROMOTE THE USE OF GOOD AGRICULTURAL PRACTICES/TECHNOLOGIES, INCREASE KNOWLEDGE AND AWARENESS TO SHOCKS AND STRESSES, AND INCREASE ACCESS TO DISPOSABLE INCOME THROUGH CRS' SAVINGS AND INTERNAL LENDING COMMUNITIES (SILC) METHODOLOGY. THE PROJECT WILL BUILD ON 2 YEARS OF LESSONS LEARNED THROUGH THE ZEN AND ZEN II PROJECTS WHERE SILC, DROUGHT TOLERANT CROPS, SMALL STOCK, EXTENSION AND EARLY WARNING SYSTEM WERE CITED AS KEY DRIVERS OF COMMUNITY RECOVERY.

CATHOLIC RELIEF SERVICES (CRS) AND ITS PARTNERS WILL IMPLEMENT THE PATHWAYS PROJECT IN RESPONSE TO NFO SOL- 613-17-000005. PATHWAYS WILL USE ECONOMIC STRENGTHENING, LOCAL OWNERSHIP AND LEADERSHIP, AND GENDER TRANSFORMATION TO STRENGTHEN THE CAPACITY OF HIV-AFFECTED INDIVIDUALS, HOUSEHOLDS (HH) AND COMMUNITIES TO PROGRESS ALONG PATHWAYS OUT OF POVERTY, ALONG FUNCTIONAL SERVICE REFERRAL PATHWAYS, ALONG CONTINUUM OF CARE PATHWAYS TO REACH THE 90-90-90 TARGETS, AND ALONG AGE AND STAGE APPROPRIATE PATHWAYS THAT PROMOTE POSITIVE CHILD, ADOLESCENT, AND YOUTH HEALTH, WELLBEING, AND DEVELOPMENT. PATHWAYS WILL DELIVER A CHILD-CENTERED, FAMILY-FOCUSED, COMMUNITY-BASED PACKAGE OF EVIDENCE-BASED/INFORMED INTERVENTIONS IN BULAWAYO, GURUVE, GWERU, HARARE, INSIZA, LUPANE, MATOBO, MAZOWE AND NKAYI. THE PROGRAM WILL BE IMPLEMENTED IN COLLABORATION WITH THE GOVERNMENT OF ZIMBABWE AT NATIONAL AND DISTRICT LEVEL AND USAID TO ENSURE A COORDINATED AND SUSTAINABLE PROVISION OF QUALITY SERVICES.
